poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: But shouldn't it start from nothing, not from words? It does: they talk to me Then they shut up and we all listen - Well, most of us. Loose talk cost the lives of pagan gods Sunlight spelunking, looking for a human bud to nip. They're no great loss. Unless they've taken realms of silence with them, Sequestering almost all but the name of poet.
